intro: Hartmannia berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican violet, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Hartmannia berlandieri prefers shady, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
